Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
The video stream authenticity validation is critical to balance against the rise of deepfake tech. Used to be you could never trust what a politician was saying. Nowadays you cant even trust that it's the politician saying it.
Do notarys back up the stream for tampering analysis later?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am not sure its feasable to have notaries keep it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But once the raw data is notarised any copy can be verified

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It doesnt make sense to have all notaries keepng a copy of everything ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You never know what the data might be... dont want the service to be dissapeared because someone used it for somehting bad.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just notarise the data against KMD for a fee then remove it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why keep the raw data?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: anybody with the rawdata can verify the hashes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the authentication is built in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but a single miner chain should also prevent anybody other than notaries from doing tx to keep it pure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is really an edge case as usually blockchains have multiple writers, but it does solve a usecase on the broadcast receivers side

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: very cool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it is often that some unusual things are found at the edges

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like PIRATE without taddr, this one with a single miner/tx creator

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
yes I have a few issues at the moment ... Trying to figure out the notary node miner, that needs to spend 0.0001 utxo to create the TX  atm.  
Might take another day yet. However I am taking it slow and thinking it through trying to make the least amount of changes as I can. Right now I have it so that the coinbase TX can only be mined by the ac_pubkey as a conesnsus rule, but anyone who mines also mines to that pubkey. So I need to add the notary miner to that, so they also need the private key. 
what I have so far is:
1. every block generated under 128 makes 2 p2pk utxo's and every block over  128 makes 1.
2. both these p2pk are to ac_pubkey as a consesnus rule, unless the ac_pubkey owner gives anyone coins, no body else can make transactions. 

This I assume will be launched similar to how Alright designed the oracles and assetchains.json. The dAPP user pays the notaries and funds them, and there is some kind of setting for when the chain is to be stopped being notarised, and then it can be removed from al notaries.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: good point re: the liability of storing unknown censorship resistant data

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes... the chain is owned by the chain creator, notaries just provide a service to make it immutable.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Really any data at all can be used here... not just video.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the use cases will be unknown until people can use it.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: just wondering how to counter potential tampering pre/on stream. as long as a copy exists, it can be analysed. Tampering after stream is exposed well by notary hash. Catching tampering ealier is probably beyond scope though.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: welll the chain creator is sending into the mempool and minging the chain, all they need to do is put enough hash at it so mine the blocks as fast as the data is being generated.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I guess I have enough f it done to see what that limit is before it breaks ü§î

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: any data... like a GPS sensor stream...? This would expand well into scientific survey data. Plenty of sensors out there collecting

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: if you have chain of custody validated from source, no-one can fudge the numbers without spoofing them to begin with

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: well yes ... I guess so... as the chain iteself is trusted, but once the blockchain is notarised and more people have a copy, then its locked in. Unless KMD and BTC dissapear.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: for things like sensors and stuff... depends how much data, likely if its not huge bandwidth required a normal chain can be used.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Sensor data without imagery band components are pretty low kb, even if collecting in realtime. Most sensors only poll periodically to conserve power  or because rate of change isn't rapid enough to warrant continuous capture.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: lightweight json strings for temperature, windspeed, acidity etc etc

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Likely those kind of things would just use a notarised chain with oracles I guess... This kind of chain, is for big data...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and on off usecases .. say a video interview of a wistleblower... or whatever anyone can think of.

Author: blackjok3r#3181

I found a good trick, if you dont know what type some data is, is to just printf a string, then compile and the compiler will tell you what type it actually is. üòÇ  
its slow going, but it works
